_comment: Created by EFisher on 26/03/2014 17:03:28 using v2.1
title: How has the number of community nurses changed?
analysis_commentary:
Despite the recent increase in the overall numbers of qualified nursing, midwifery and health visiting staff, this has not been a pattern uniformly seen across all types of nurse groups and the main driver for the underlying fluctuations and overall numbers are nurses in Acute, Elderly & General settings (data not shown).

For community based nurses the levels of full time equivalents have either remained relatively static (community psychiatry nurses - data not shown) or decreased between September 2009 and October 2013. The latter has been observed in both community learning disability services, which has dropped to 2,071 full time equivalents - a 22.6% decrease compared to September 2009 - and community services, which dropped to 45,943 nurses - a 4.5% decrease compared to September 2009.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, NHS Hospital & Community Health Service Workforce Statistics
